title: How to Make a Post Thread on X (Formerly Twitter)

steps.title: Compose a new post.
steps.content: Compose a new post. Click on the Post button in the sidebar, or click into the textbox near the top of the screen. In the X app, tap on the blue + icon, which you can see at the bottom of the screen. If you're not logged into X , you'll need to do that before you can post.

steps.title: Write your post.
steps.content: Write your post. Write something under 280 characters in the What's happening? field. Read How to Write a Good Tweet for tips on what to say. If you go over the character limit, the text that is over the limit will be highlighted in red.

steps.title: Add another post.
steps.content: Add another post. Click or tap the + button near the bottom of the post window and write your next post. You can only see this button if you've already written something in the post field. To add additional posts to the thread, click or tap the + button again.

steps.title: Post your thread.
steps.content: Post your thread. When you have finished, click on the Post all button at the bottom of the post window to post your thread on X. On mobile, tap the Post button in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: View your thread.
steps.content: View your thread. Go to your profile and click or tap Show more replies to expand the entire thread. [1] X Research source
